\long\def\drawtest#1#2;{%
    \@tempdima=\pgfutil@tempdimb
    \@tempdimb=.8\pgfutil@tempdimb
    \@tempdimb=\pgfutil@tempdimb
    \@tempdimb=0.08\pgfutil@tempdimb
    \fill#1;\fill#2;
    \@tempdima=\pgfutil@tempdimb
    \@tempdimb=\pgfutil@tempdimb
    \@tempdimb=.7\pgfutil@tempdimb
    \fill#1!
       \@tempdima,
       0  -.1\pgfutil@tempdimb
       --++ \@tempdimb,\pgfutil@tempdimb
       --++-\pgfutil@tempdimb
       (@tempdima,\pgfutil@tempdimb)
       --++-\pgfutil@tempdimb
       @tempdima,.1\pgfutil@tempdimb
       --++ 0 -.15\pgfutil@tempdimb      
       (@tempdima,-\pgfutil@tempdimb)
       --++-\pgfutil@tempdimb
       @tempdima,-.1\pgfutil@tempdimb  
       --++-\pgfutil@tempdimb
       (@tempdima,\pgfutil@tempdimb)
    ;       
    \fill#2!
       \@tempdima,
       0.15\pgfutil@tempdimb      
       --++ \@tempdimb,\pgfutil@tempdimb
       --++-\pgfutil@tempdimb
       (0.15\pgfutil@tempdima+\pgfutil@tempdimb,\pgfutil@tempdimb)
       --++-\pgfutil@tempdimb
       (0.15\pgfutil@tempdima+\pgfutil@tempdimb),\pgfutil@tempdimb
       --++-\pgfutil@tempdimb
       (0.15\pgfutil@tempdima+\pgfutil@tempdimb),-\pgfutil@tempdimb
       --++-\pgfutil@tempdimb
       (0.15\pgfutil@tempdima+\pgfutil@tempdimb),-\pgfutil@tempdimb    
       ;       
}

\newcount\lastnodemark
\def\isnode#1{%
    \ifnum#1=\lastnodemark
    \else
        \toks@\expandafter\v@s@#1\relax
        \is@
        #1%
    \fi
}
\def\v@s@#1{% replace v@
        \@v@s@#1%
        \aftergroup\v@s@toks@embedded%
}%

\def\@v@s@toks@embedded#1{% replace v@
        #1%
        \advance\lastnodemark by 1%
        \edef\toks@{\the\toks@,\the\toks@}%
}%

        %Interrupts at x=0.5 + i
        \foreach \in [count=\i from 1] in {2,4}{
            % Places the coordinates at base 2 size, so that it takes half the distance of an edge
            % to draw from point to point. Interrupts are placed on an edge midway.
            \draw[dashed] (0.5+\i,0) --++ (-2,0);
            % Places a dot halfway on the edge. The placement is better if the next 
            % point is expected to be within the domain of the coordinate.
            \filldraw (0.5+\i,-0.7) circle[radius=1pt];
            % Interrupts are placed on an edge halfway.
            %% Added %% to make the placement look better.
            %% Also, the placement could be absolute. In that case,
            %% one could just use [/pgf/decoration/interrupt placement
            %%     at position x,mouseover bridge].
            %% We use a yshift to move the mark away from the edge.
            %% The negative of the distance of an edge can be used to further  
            %% adjust the placement. 
            \draw[interrupt] (-0.5+\i,-1) --++ (0,2.65+0.3*\i);
            %% Alternative method: replace the ++ by a subtractive coordinate 
            %% difference.            
            %% The overlay option is used to place the mark slightly ahead of the path.
                %% If omitted, the placement is relative.            
            \node[yshift=-0.3cm,
            xshift= 0.3cm,
            overlay] at (0.5+\i,0.7) {$II_\in$};           
        }

        %Interrupts at x=0.5 + 2i/3
        %% Added overlay to the previous coordinate to place the second interruption 
        %% interrupt at the right edge.

        %Interrupts at x=0.5 + 2i/3+2/3
        \path[overlay] (-0.66*2.236060,-0.21*1.142040) coordinate (A)
                -- ++ (-0.66*1.071404,0.29*1.142040) coordinate (C)
                -- ++ (0.83*0.208899,0.25*1.142040) coordinate (E)
                -- ++ (0.83*0.208899,-0.25*1.142040) coordinate (G);

        %% Since the edges are notendet near the midpoint,
